CHAT.GIVEPH PERMISSION: Only a GM can increase PH
CHAT.MISSING ACTOR: Cannot find any character with the name {actor}.
CHAT.PRACTICE MESSAGE:
{actors}: finally stand down time after a cruesome meat grinder.
The next battle comes soon, but there is enough time for {phGain} hours of practice.
CHAT.FIRING EMPTY WEAPON: {name} tried to fire an empty weapon. All they got in return is the sound of the trigger clicking.
CHAT.REROLLING: {name} rerolled a {check} check, changing a dice from {old} to {new}.
CHAT.SAME NAME EFFECT: This created a new effect under the same name.

COMBAT.MULTI TARGET HELP: Can this weapon damage multiple targets at once? E.g. grenade launchers.
COMBAT.RELOAD DURATION EXTENSION: Additional time to reload this ammunation
COMBAT.WEAPON PROF TOTAL: 50% General proficiency + 50% specific proficiency + 25% neighbour proficiency

CRIT FAIL EVENT.SPONTANEOUS DISCHARGE:
Weapon Spontaneously discharges and fires again with the currently selected fire mode.
Perform a Crd check:
- QL 0 - 3: The shot hits a random structure within a 90deg arc infront of you.
- QL > 3: Perform another attack modified -8+QL against your last target. - FL < 0: Attack a random creature within 20m and a 90deg arch infront of you, with modifier -FL.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.JAM: Weapon jams, which takes 2 actions to fix (strding permited during this). Pass a Foc check +5 to recognise this immediatly, otherwise only recognise it when you attempt your next fire action.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.OPTICS DE-ADJUSTED: Weapon now has a -2 on all aimed shots until optics are realigned, taking one action.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.OVERHEATING: Barrel overheats. Weapon cannot be used for one BR or obtain 1d3 damage and a burn with at a 25% chance per firing action in the next BR.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.FLICKED SAFETY ON: Weapons safety accidentally switched on, taking no actions to fix. Pass a Foc check to recognise this immediatly, otherwise only recognise this when you attempt your next fire action.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.TRIGGER JAM: Trigger jams in the firing position, taking one action to fix. If the last shot was fired in automatic mode, the weapon empties itself and you have to pass a Crd check, otherwise you hit a random creature within 20m and a 90deg arc infront of you.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.MAG DROP: You accidentally release the mag. Empty the weapon. Picking the mag up takes 1 action in addition to usual reload cost.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.RANDOM DISCHARGE: At the beginning of the next BR your weapon discharges randomly at your last selected firing mode. Pass a Crd check, otherwise hit a random creature within 20m and a 90deg arc infront of you. At FL < -3 you hit yourself in the foot.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.BROKEN GRIP: Parts of the grips broke, both leading attributes of your weapon increase by 2 until fixed, taking 5min.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.BARREL MISALIGNED: Weapon now has a -1 on all shots until barrel is realigned, taking two actions.
CRIT FAIL EVENT.BARRAL DAMAGED: Barrel tip fractures. All shots now deal 1 less damage untill barrel is changed (this can stack).
CRIT FAIL EVENT.CATASTROPHIC FAILURE: The weapon suffers a critical failure, becoming unusable until repaired (taking an hour).

HERO TOKEN.ATTRIBUTE: {name} used a hero token to improve an ability check.
HERO TOKEN.PROFICIENCY: {name} used a hero token to improve a proficiency check.
HERO TOKEN.WEAPON: {name} used a hero token to improve a combat check.

NOTIFICATIONS.DESTROYED: Armour piece {name} was destroyed in combat
NOTIFICATIONS.EQUIPBROKEN: Cannot equip broken armour (i.e., no structure points).
NOTIFICATIONS.REQUIRES GM: Needs GM privleges to apply damage
NOTIFICATIONS.AMMU MISSING: Weapon is not loaded and can't be fired
NOTIFICATIONS.AP MISSING: Not enough Advantage Points to gain {name}. {need} needed, {available} available.
NOTIFICATIONS.AP MISSING DELETION: Not enough Advantage Points to delete {name}. {need} needed, {available} available.
NOTIFICATIONS.AP MISSING DECREMENT: Not enough Advantage Points to decrement {name}. {need} needed, {available} available.
NOTIFICATIONS.NO TOKEN: There is no player token on the current game scene.
NOTIFICATIONS.TOO MANY TARGETS: Too many targets. {weapon} attacks can at most target {max} targets.
NOTIFICATIONS.INVALID HR ZONE: Cannot use skill {skill} in HR zone {zone}.
NOTIFICATIONS.WRONG COST STRING: Something wrong with the skill cost {str}. It can only be a single number or one number per level, separated by '/'.
NOTIFICATIONS.WRONG HR COST FORMAT: Cannot parse hr cost of skill {skill}. The cost has to either be a number, a percantage with an optional number in brackets or 'N.A.'. Got {str} instead.
NOTIFICATIONS.WRONG HR COST STRING: Something wrong with the hr cost of skill {name}. It has to be either one or three numbers, separated by '/'.
NOTIFICATIONS.EFFECT ALREADY EXISTS: An effect for this item already exists. Rename or delete previous effect.
NOTIFICATIONS.NO ATTACHABLE ARMOUR: There is no armour avaible to which this can be attached to.
NOTIFICATIONS.MISSING ATTACHMENT POINTS: Cannot attach to this armour. It has {available} attachment points left, but {needed} are needed.
NOTIFICATIONS.MISSING PH: Not enough PH to learn {name}. {need} needed, {available} available.
NOTIFICATIONS.MISSING REQUIREMENTS: Skill has unmatched requirements. Skill {name} has to be at {value} first.
NOTIFICATIONS.UNMET REQUIREMENTS: Skill has unmatched requirements. {name} has to be {value}, but is {valueIs}.
NOTIFICATIONS.MAX LEVEL: {name} is already at it's max level.
NOTIFICATIONS.PH MISSING: Not enough PH to bring {name} to {level}. {need} needed, {available} available.
NOTIFICATIONS.CORE VALUE TOO SMALL: 'General weapon proficiency' too small. Level {level} needed but it is at {basic}.
NOTIFICATIONS.CORE VALUE COMBATICS TOO SMALL: Basic combat proficiency (average str and crd) for 'Hand-to-Hand combat' is too small. {level} needed but it is at {basic}.
NOTIFICATIONS.NO ACTORS TO LEVEL UP: Could not give PH to any character. Make sure they have a player owner.

SETTINGS.SimpleMacroShorthandL: Enable a shortened macro syntax which allows referencing attributes directly, for example @str instead of @attributes.str.value. Disable this setting if you need the ability to reference the full attribute model, for example @attributes.str.value.
SETTINGS.SimpleInitFormulaL: Enter an initiative formula, such as d20+d@attributes.str.value

SIMPLE.NotifyGroupAttrDuplicate: Attribute group already exists as an attribute.
SIMPLE.NotifyGroupAlphanumeric: Attribute group names may not contain spaces or periods.
SIMPLE.NotifyGroupReserved: Attribute group "{key}" is reserved and cannot be used.
SIMPLE.NotifyAttrDuplicate: Attribute key already exists as a group.
SIMPLE.NotifyAttrInvalid: Attribute keys may not contain spaces or periods.

TEXT.EFFECTS:
Add a status modifiery to your attributes, proficiencies, weapon proficiencies and other character attributes.
For this write 'Attributes.NAME', 'Proficiencies.NAME', 'Weapons.NAME'. This is generally case-insensitive, except for specific proficiency and weapon names. You can also use group names, for example 'attributes.physical' or 'weapons.Energy'. Furthermore there is an 'all' specifier to affect everything.
Other modifiers: 'health', 'heartRate.[min,max]', 'bloodVolumn'.
TEXT.HARMLESS EXPLOSION: The grenade explodes without damaging any creatures.

TOOLTIP.DESIGNATED WEAPON: Some types of ammunition are only useable with specific names. Specify these here by their names (comma separated).
TOOLTIP.PENETRATION: The penetration value reduces the armour's threshold.
TOOLTIP.STRAIN LEVEL 1: Examples: Walking, striding, throwing, firing a weapon, normal swimming
TOOLTIP.STRAIN LEVEL 2: Examples: Running, jumping, climbing, fast swimming
TOOLTIP.STRAIN LEVEL 3: Examples: Sprinting, maximal physical efforts, melee combat
TOOLTIP.HEALS: Improves condition of the wound, allowing further treatments afterwards
TOOLTIP.TREATS: Improves condition of the wound, but prevents further treatments
TOOLTIP.EMP: Applies effects on mechs and robots
TOOLTIP.SMOKE: Creates a smoke screen at the detonation location

LONG REST CHAT: Spent 2.5h to take a long rest.
NAME: Name
SHORT REST CHAT: Spent 1h to take a short rest.
